meanings.definition: The use of echoes in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: The echoisms in the cave made his voice sound louder.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the echoisms of her own voice bouncing off the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The echoisms in the empty room made her giggle.
meanings.sent4: His speech was filled with echoisms, as if his words were bouncing back at him.
meanings.sent5: The echoisms in the canyon created a mesmerizing effect.

meanings.definition: A tendency to repeat or imitate others.
meanings.sent1: Her echoisms of her friend's phrases annoyed some people.
meanings.sent2: His echoisms of his favorite comedian's jokes always made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent3: The echoisms of the parrot entertained the guests at the party.
meanings.sent4: His echoisms of his boss's mannerisms were uncanny.
meanings.sent5: The echoisms of the students copying each other's answers were obvious.

meanings.definition: The study or analysis of echoes.
meanings.sent1: The scientist's echoisms revealed interesting patterns in sound waves.
meanings.sent2: She dedicated her career to the echoisms of sound reverberations.
meanings.sent3: The echoisms of the acoustics in the concert hall fascinated the audience.
meanings.sent4: His echoisms of the echoes in the canyon led to groundbreaking discoveries.
